node.text:
Across the world, women have been posting slogans on streets, walls and buildings to raise awareness of femicide and fight against everyday sexism.

The number of women in the UK killed or suspected of being killed by men in 2021 has reached 100, according to data collated by Counting Dead Women, a Femicide Census project.

The slogan campaign was started by a lone activist in Paris, and has spread in the UK too.

The women who go on pasting missions risk a fine if they're caught, but say it's a way for their voices to be heard.

#Feminism #Women #BBCNews

node.title: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters

node.text:
Major General Chris Donahue is the last American to board the final US military flight out of Afghanistan.

As the Taliban took over Kabul airport at the start of 31 August - the deadline President Biden had set for US withdrawal - shots were fired into the skies in celebration.

#Afghanistan #Taliban #BBCNews

node.title: The last US soldier leaves Afghanistan

node.text:
Louisiana residents may be in the dark for weeks as officials take stock of the damage from Hurricane Ida, which has been downgraded to a tropical storm.

Ida made landfall on Sunday with 150mph (240km/h) winds, the fifth strongest to ever hit the US mainland. 

About one million locals remain without power.

Tap the link in our bio to learn more about the impact of the storm.

#HurricaneIda #Louisiana #NewOrleans #Nola #BBCNews

node.title: Counting the cost after Hurricane Ida

node.text:
A 20-storey block of flats in Milan, Italy was engulfed in flames on Sunday.

The apartment block is only 10 years old, and Milan Mayor Beppe Sala said it was "unacceptable that such a modern building should have proved totally vulnerable".

#Milan #Italy #Fire #BBCNews

node.title: Milan block of flats in flames

node.text:
The ancient art of pigeon fancying enjoyed a revival during the pandemic.

As restrictions eased in Turkey over the summer, enthusiasts have started to once again gather at Edirnekapı, Istanbul's largest pigeon market under the old Byzantine city walls.

#Animals #Pigeons #Turkey #BBCNews

node.title: Pigeon-keeping in Istanbul on the rise

node.text:
"Possum skin cloaks tell our story."

The Aboriginal cultural tradition of using possum skin cloaks to express identity was almost lost after colonisation - but it's now making a comeback.

#Australia #BBCNews

node.title: The revival of possum cloaks in Australia

node.text:
Best known for bridal wear, dressing the likes of Priyanka Chopra-Jonas and Deepika Padukone on their wedding days, Sabyasachi Mukherjee designs have been worn by many stars, including Oprah Winfrey and Sophie Turner.

He explains why he teamed up with H&M for recent collection 'Wanderlust'.

#BBCNews

node.title: Sabyasachi Mukherjee: Wanderlust collection was about India

Since the Taliban took control of Herat, residents say their lives have totally changed, and they now fear for their safety.

The BBC has been speaking to people in Afghanistan’s third-largest city, with a population estimated to be more than 500,000.

#Afghanistan #BBCNews

node.text:
Cows have been airlifted from a Swiss Alpine meadow in a process used by farmers to move injured animals.

The process is done annually to the members of the herd who can't walk down from their summer pasture.

#BBCNews

node.title: Cows airlifted from Swiss Alpine meadow

node.text:
The US has employed thousands of Afghans since the beginning the war in Afghanistan to help their troops - many of whom are now under threat due to the Taliban resurgence.

A centre in America is now helping Afghans who relocated to the US identify and track family members in their home country who are now at risk.

#Afghanistan #Taliban #BBCNews

node.title: 'I helped the US in Afghanistan, now my family is at risk'

node.text:
Is it really possible to buy your way out of creating harmful greenhouse gases that cause climate change? 

Governments, companies and individuals already participate in carbon offsetting schemes that try to balance their emissions by finding other ways to reduce carbon in the atmosphere by an equivalent amount.

BBC Reality Check's Chris Morris considers whether carbon offsetting is a viable method to tackle climate change.

#BBCNews

node.title: Can carbon offsetting help the planet?

node.text:
British swimmer Dan Pepper had always dreamed of competing at the Paralympic Games but the opportunity was taken from him, he says, when a ban was imposed on intellectual impairment sports in the Paralympics.

The ban came into force after a huge scandal at Sydney 2000, when the Spanish basketball team were found to have cheated their way to gold. It was discovered that of the 12 players, only two were genuinely disabled.

Although the ban was lifted in 2009 for certain sports, there are still fewer medals available for intellectual impairment athletes today than there were in 2000.

#BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 31, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'BBC NEWS Geronimo the alpaca killed by UK government vets after lengthy legal battle'.

node.text:
After a failed last-ditch battle in court, an alpaca at the middle of a legal row with the UK government has been killed by vets.

Geronimo tested positive for bovine tuberculosis and was ordered to be put down, but his owner Helen Macdonald said the test was flawed as it was made for a different kind of animal.

Supporters had been camping out at the farm to try to prevent officials arriving to destroy Geronimo, but police and staff from the Department of Food, Environment and Rural Affairs took him away earlier.

Ms Macdonald said the government had refused to act in good faith and had ignored her pleas for communication, Downing Street has expressed sympathy for Ms Macdonald “and any others that are affected by this terrible disease."

Tap the link in bio to read more about the legal battle surrounding Geronimo the alpaca.

(📷 PA, SWNS)

node.text:
Across the world, women have been posting slogans on streets, walls and buildings to raise awareness of femicide and fight against everyday sexism.

The number of women in the UK killed or suspected of being killed by men in 2021 has reached 100, according to data collated by Counting Dead Women, a Femicide Census project.

The slogan campaign was started by a lone activist in Paris, and has spread in the UK too.

The women who go on pasting missions risk a fine if they're caught, but say it's a way for their voices to be heard.

#Feminism #Women #BBCNews

node.text:
Major General Chris Donahue is the last American to board the final US military flight out of Afghanistan.

As the Taliban took over Kabul airport at the start of 31 August - the deadline President Biden had set for US withdrawal - shots were fired into the skies in celebration.

#Afghanistan #Taliban #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 30, 2021.

node.text:
The last soldier to leave Afghanistan on the day the US concluded its 20-year war has been identified as Major General Chris Donahue. 

His departure closed the US mission to evacuate American citizens and vulnerable Afghans. 

“This was an incredibly tough, pressurized mission filled with multiple complexities, with active threats the entire time. Our troops displayed grit, discipline and empathy,” said the XVIII Airborne Corps in a tweet.

With the country now back in their hands, Taliban supporters celebrated across Kabul, coming out on the streets and firing shots into the sky. 

Tap the link in our bio for more live updates on the situation in Afghanistan, and what the future holds for the people left behind. 

(📸: US Central Command Public Affairs)

#Afghanistan #Kabul #BBCNews

node.text:
Louisiana residents may be in the dark for weeks as officials take stock of the damage from Hurricane Ida, which has been downgraded to a tropical storm.

Ida made landfall on Sunday with 150mph (240km/h) winds, the fifth strongest to ever hit the US mainland. 

About one million locals remain without power.

Tap the link in our bio to learn more about the impact of the storm.

#HurricaneIda #Louisiana #NewOrleans #Nola #BBCNews

node.text:
A 20-storey block of flats in Milan, Italy was engulfed in flames on Sunday.

The apartment block is only 10 years old, and Milan Mayor Beppe Sala said it was "unacceptable that such a modern building should have proved totally vulnerable".

#Milan #Italy #Fire #BBCNews

node.text:
The ancient art of pigeon fancying enjoyed a revival during the pandemic.

As restrictions eased in Turkey over the summer, enthusiasts have started to once again gather at Edirnekapı, Istanbul's largest pigeon market under the old Byzantine city walls.

#Animals #Pigeons #Turkey #BBCNews

node.text:
"Possum skin cloaks tell our story."

The Aboriginal cultural tradition of using possum skin cloaks to express identity was almost lost after colonisation - but it's now making a comeback.

#Australia #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on August 29, 2021. May be an image of 3 people and text that says 'BBNEWS NEWS Ed Asner, Emmy-winning star of Lou Grant and Up, dies aged 91'.

node.text:
Ed Asner, best-known for playing fictional TV newsman Lou Grant, has died aged 91.
 
The actor, who also endeared himself to a new generation of fans by voicing elderly widower Carl Fredericksen in the Pixar hit Up, passed away “peacefully” on Sunday, his family said. 
 
"Words cannot express the sadness we feel. With a kiss on your head - goodnight dad. We love you."
 
The character Lou Grant was first introduced as Mary Richards's boss on the iconic The Mary Tyler Moore Show in the 1970s. Grant, the irascible editor of the fictional Los Angeles Tribune, then became a character in a show of his own from 1977 to 1982.
 
The role helped earn Asner seven Emmy awards - the most for a male performer. 
 
Tap the link in our bio to read more about his illustrious career. 
 
(📸: Getty Images)

#BBCNews

node.text:
Best known for bridal wear, dressing the likes of Priyanka Chopra-Jonas and Deepika Padukone on their wedding days, Sabyasachi Mukherjee designs have been worn by many stars, including Oprah Winfrey and Sophie Turner.

He explains why he teamed up with H&M for recent collection 'Wanderlust'.

#BBCNews

node.text:
Since the Taliban took control of Herat, residents say their lives have totally changed, and they now fear for their safety.

The BBC has been speaking to people in Afghanistan’s third-largest city, with a population estimated to be more than 500,000.

#Afghanistan #BBCNews

node.text:
Cows have been airlifted from a Swiss Alpine meadow in a process used by farmers to move injured animals.

The process is done annually to the members of the herd who can't walk down from their summer pasture.

#BBCNews
